node.title: Kaimaumau fire: Firefighters working to control month-old blaze
node.description: Fire and Emergency is warning hot windy weather in the Far North may lead to flare ups in the month-old blaze burning near Waiharahara.
node.content:
["Fire and Emergency is warning hot windy weather in the Far North may lead to flare ups in the month-old blaze burning near Waiharahara.", "", "
Northland Kaimaumau fire as seen from Reef Lodge Motel in Rangiputa. The fire has now been burning for 31 days. Photo: Supplied / Reef Lodge Motel
", "There are 63 firefighters working to control a fire burning near Waiharahara in the Far North.", "The blaze began 31 days ago and was under control until a break out on Saturday.", "The fire has grown after the break out and now covers 2530 hectares.", "Fire and Emergency New Zealand said there may be more flare ups this afternoon due to hot windy weather, and it had resources available in case the situation deteriorated.", "Three properties were evacuated on Saturday and those households have not been able to fully return yet."]
